attributes.action: No to British military intervention, air strikes, no fly zone, or troops on the ground in Syria.  No further arming or funding of rebel groups.
attributes.additional_details:
No to any sort of British military intervention in Syria (including air strikes, policing of a no fly zone, or troops on the ground).  No further British supplying, arming or funding of rebel groups in Syria.

The British government -and William Hague in particular- seems desparate to suck us into another bloody and costly war which Britain has no interest in and no desire to engage in.  William Hague is making many unfounded claims about who carried out the alleged chemical attack in Damuscus when no facts are available on what happened or who was involved and is dragging us towards military involvement.  If other nations wish to get involved in the Syrian war that is an issue for them, we do not want Britons dying or British funds used on this.
